description.narrative: national and sub-national health and environment authorities in target areas have improved capacity to legislate, budget, deliver and coordinate interventions to mitigate the impact of air pollution on child survival, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children in Mongolia benefit from increased access to and utilization of services that promote health and nutrition, including WASH and interventions that mitigate the impact of air pollution on child survival.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: national and sub-national health and environment authorities in target areas have improved capacity to legislate, budget, deliver and coordinate interventions to mitigate the impact of air pollution on child survival
Proportion of target facilities (kindergartens, schools) maintaining satisfactory IAQ
Bayankhongor government has strengthened its policy and institutional capacity to reduce air pollution related maternal and child health risks
Existence of Inter-ministerial agreement on research priorities on air pollution and maternal and child health
